data.title: Giving
data.text:
Mission Statement - "ARM Prison Outreach is an arm of the church to help fulfill the biblical mandate of Jesus, 'I was in prison and you came to visit me,' Matthew 25:36, NIV. Our specialized programs are designed to proclaim the love and message in Jesus to the incarcerated, help lead them into a sacing and personal relationship with the Savior, build them up in the faith, and equip them for a lifetime of faithful service in the Lord's Kingdom."

Sutherland Church of Christ supports ARM monthly. To donate personally, go ahead and click the button below and give online, or you may mail your contribution to:

American Rehabilitation Ministries

P.O. Box 1490

Joplin, Missouri 64802-9100

Emrys Rees, a second-generaion missionary, along with his wife, Usha, continue the work begun long ago by his parents, David and Lois Rees. Their mission empases are in leadership training, discipling, and strengthening of the congregations in both urban and rural areas (which they say is like working in two different countries). They work with youth groups, ladies' groups, men's groups, small groups and children. during the last few years, they have emphasized evangelism among a least-reached people group. Emrys and Usha plant independent churches that will duplicated themselves long after their time on the mission field has passed.

Midwest Christian Services (MCS) is a residential treatment program for adolescent males between the ages of 8 to 18. The average length of stay is 9 to 18 months, although each individual's case is different. MCS is licensed by the Iowa Department of Human Services to provide Comprehensive Rehabiliation and Supportive Residential services.

MCS is a unique program because of its Christian philosophy. Through modeling, authentic love, nurturing and teaching, the Board and staff of MCS provide an environment in which positive changes can be made and the journey to wholeness can begin.

www.midwestchristianservices.com

To support MCS, you may mail your contribution to the address below:

Midwest Christian Services

4509 20th Avenue

Peterson, Iowa 51047

For God’s Children International’s motto is: “Providing hope, dignity and love in Jesus’ name.” It is FGCI’s mission to replace despair with the hope of Christ, humiliation with the dignity of Christ, and indifference with the love of Jesus Christ. “We proclaim him, admonishing and teaching everyone with all wisdom, so that we may present everyone perfect in Christ. To this end (we) labor, struggling with all his energy, which so powerfully works in (us)” (Colossians 1: 28, 29 NIV).

For God’s Children International exists to serve abandoned, suffering, poor and marginalized children, by caring for their physical and spiritual needs. “For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in, I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me . . . I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me” (Matthew 25:35, 36 & 40b NIV). Above all, we desire to serve and glorify God and to share the Good News of His Son Jesus Christ with a hurting world in need of a Savior.

Camp Nebowa is located on beautiful Blue Lake, four miles outside of Onawa, Iowa. Nebowa is a non-denominational camp primarily serving church's of the Restoration Movement (Christian Church/Church of Chrsit). Nebowa has summer camps for students going into first grade to graduated high school seniors.

At camp, you can experience exciting praise and worship times, challenging lessons, wonderful rec times reflective campfires, and great friendships.

Most importantly, Camp Nebowa has faculty who love Jesus and who have a desire to help young people discover the difference He can have in their lives.

To personally support this mission, you can mail your contribution to:

Nebowa Christian Camp

P.O. Box 222

Onawa, Iowa 51040

Noah's Ark Daycare Center was formed to serve a need in the community for quality child care. It is committed to providing a Christ-centered home-like atmosphere where children, their families, and staff alike are treated with compassion and respect.

Noah's Ark Daycare thrives on fundraising from events hosted by Sutherland Church of Christ such as an annual 5k & mile walk Labor Day weekend and a delicious soup supper served around the holiday's.

If you wish to personally support Noah's Ark Daycare Center, you can mail your contribution to the address below:

Noah's Ark Daycare Center

203 S. Oak Street

Sutherland, Iowa 51058
